intro: Buglossoides calabra, commonly known as Calabrian bugloss, is a perennial flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family, characterized by its hairy stems and showy blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or dry soils, preferring full sun exposure. Its flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Buglossoides calabra is often used in ornamental gardening for its vibrant color and drought tolerance.
